Patch Set 2:

Thanks Fei Long for your suggestion. Doing it by weight is definitely more intuitive. However, I have made a slight chance from your example. I have followed nova's example - higher weights return first. Locations with no metadata weight_key defined will intuitively be weight 0.

Patch Set 6: Code-Review+1

Patch Set 6:

(1 comment)

I spent some time trying to verify that this patch implements the use case described in the bug, and determined that this is not going to be an easy feature to use.  So I'll paste my notes in here so maybe they can be used in the docs or something.  But also see my comment inline about making this a little more user-friendly.

The setup is that we've got 3 glance API nodes, cell-a which has a fast local store, cell-b which has a fast local store, and cell-c which doesn't.

The 3 glance API nodes would be configured like this:

  cell-a glance-api.conf:
    metadata_weight_key = A
    location_strategy = metadata_weight

  cell-b glance-api.conf:
    metadata_weight_key = B
    location_strategy = metadata_weight

  cell-c glance-api.conf:
    location_strategy = location_order

Then we've got some images with multiple locations.  Each image is weighted slightly differently so you can see what effect that has on the ordering.

  Image 1: locations:
  [{"url": "nfs://somewhere/loc",
    "metadata": {"A": 5, "B": 5, "idx": "0"}},
   {"url": "rbd://cell-a/loc",
    "metadata": {"A": 10 , "B": 0, "idx": "1"}},
   {"url": "rbd://cell-b/loc",
    "metadata": {"A": 0, "B": 10, "idx": "2"}},
   {"url": "swift://default/loc",
    "metadata": {"idx": "3"}}]
  
  Image 2: locations:
  [{"url": "nfs://somewhere/loc",
    "metadata": {"A": 5, "B": 5, "idx": "0"}},
   {"url": "rbd://cell-a/loc",
    "metadata": {"A": 10 , "idx": "1"}},
   {"url": "rbd://cell-b/loc",
    "metadata": {"B": 10, "idx": "2"}},
   {"url": "swift://default/loc",
    "metadata": {"idx": "3"}}]
  
  Image 3: locations:
  [{"url": "nfs://somewhere/loc",
    "metadata": {"A": 5, "B": 5, "idx": "0"}},
   {"url": "rbd://cell-a/loc",
    "metadata": {"A": 10 , "idx": "1"}},
   {"url": "rbd://cell-b/loc",
    "metadata": {"B": 10, "idx": "2"}},
   {"url": "swift://default/loc",
    "metadata": {"A": 0, "B": 0, "idx": "3"}}]

And here are the orderings each API node will see:

  cell-a ordering
  Image 1: cell-a, nfs, cell-b, swift
  Image 2: cell-a, nfs, cell-b, swift
  Image 3: cell-a, nfs, swift, cell-b
  
  cell-b ordering
  Image 1: cell-b, nfs, cell-a, swift
  Image 2: cell-b, nfs, cell-a, swift
  Image 3: cell-b, nfs, swift, cell-a
  
  cell-c ordering
  Image 1: nfs, cell-a, cell-b, swift
  Image 2: nfs, cell-a, cell-b, swift
  Image 3: nfs, cell-a, cell-b, swift

So what this indicates is that you need the default listed first (the sorting is stable, so it will show up first among the "unweighted" values.  Either that, or you need to assign it some value like -six.MAXINT + 1 for all the keys in use.  Also, mixing strategies may be unwise.

Finally, note that if we have "A": "100" in the metadata, that's actually going to weight the location as -six.MAXSIZE.  I suggest that we do the conversion in the code, or at least document it very clearly.

Patch Set 6: Code-Review-1

(3 comments)

Please take a look at the excellent comment from Brian above before you read these.

It almost looks to me like Glance is trying to do data transfer management/scheduling here. Please look at my comment on the bug as well for why I say this.

My open question is: Glance provides nova with property protection concepts so that if scheduling or licensing needs to be taken care of before booting an instance the appropriate measure can be taken by reading the value of those metadata.

I think we are assuming that locations are some sort of privileged metadata where the value for the metadata keys are being used to compute the optimized location.

The other strategies do not assume the same thing.

Patch Set 6:

Hi,

We are glad to see Fei Long propose an alternative and better way for operators to approach this kind of a problem. What's proposed here I3cafa44047b7529a255e5e686e78b98f30db48aa should help with the associated bug to a good extent and avoid maintaining highly complex use case upstream which may not be supportable by glance developers (as proposed in this commit).

I'm hoping that we were able to provide some direction to our operator friends.

Please leave your comments if you acknowledge that or otherwise. I hope to abandon old and not moving patches over the next few weeks.

Thank you!

Patch Set 6:

(4 comments)

I'm echoing nikhil's comment. Based on https://review.openstack.org/336761, operators can keep any customized location strategy in downstream.

Abandoned

Fei Long's implementation is superior; I am perfectly happy to abandon this patch.
Thanks Fei Long for your work! I will see if I can find an opportunity to test that code out.
